captions.text: Subscribe to our english channel: Everything about your pet!!!!!
https://www.youtube.com/user/allaboutyourpet
Fluffy!! What are you doing on my sholder?
You are already upset, you are so scared of water!
Come on, don't worry I will be very careful so
you don't suffer a bit. Come on
As I have told you in previous videos, the bath must be very calm, quiet and step by step, specially
in this case, as for Fluffy it is the first time
in his life he is going to have a bath. Isn't it? We will let him run around
in the sink. Also, I haven't dried out the water inside the sink so he gets use
to feeling the water. Next step is to open a small trickle of
warm water, always very nice and warm, and if it is his first bath
make sure that he's a little thirsty, this way he will get closer to the water, and will accept the bath much better
Come on sweetie...yes, very nice. If we can have the water at the same temperature as the body,
He will not even notice that it is water. The first times we will wet all the body,
trying to avoid the head and face. Shampoo can not  fall into the face. I have not
told you that Fluffy is a Peruvian long hair guinea pig, and its
hair grows all punky. The peruvian guinea pigs are really
a mutation of the normal guinea pigs. The normal thing in a guinea pig is that he has short
hair. Then the next mutation has been the long hair guinea pig,
and the next mutation has been the Peruvian guinea pig which hair grows in all directions.
So first the shampoo, we will spread it and thats it. Lets go.
Being generous. We will try to shampoo twice. We will make massage
when rubbing in the shampoo, just like us, these massages are very
relaxing and stimulating, they are very nice. Guinea pigs scream a lot
but this doesn't mean they are having a bad time, in contraty, they make this noise
when they are asking for food, when they see us and are happy, they make other
noises when they are playing, they have a very peculiar voice. Now for the second shampoo.
Here under the tummy...A bit on the back, as I told you, this is very nice for them
they enjoy it. It also activates the intestine, you will see that after having bathed them
you will see at home that they even do more poo's than normal
and they feel really good. So we really activate their body with these
massages. They will always be massages...we will show you in videos how to do them. You can look
in YouTube, you will find various videos how to make massages shown by
real specialized professional physiotherapists. I am not the most appropriate but I must
say that the beneficious effects of the massages are exceptional. It is very,
very, very relaxing to do this. Now after having rinsed well we will go
directly to drying. We will start at a certain distance so as not to scare him.
We will control with our hand that we don't burn him. You know that some hairdryers
blow too hot air so we must calculate the distance
not to burn them. Also, Fluffy is very trendy. Try to brush him following the direction
of his hair and respecting the crests that he has.
It has been a  pleasure leaving him so nice, because he has a real natural beauty
don't you Fluffy? Peruvian guinea pigs have really amazing
crests.
